intro: Dieteria incana, commonly known as the hoary dieteria, is a flowering plant native to the temperate regions of the Northern Hemisphere. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its finely hairy foliage. The plant produces small, white to pale yellow flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the family. Dieteria incana thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in woodland or meadow habitats. Its botanical features make it a distinctive and easily identifiable species within its ecological community.
